meanings.definition: To cover or soak with water or liquid.
meanings.sent1: I will beduck the plants in the garden to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: She likes to beduck her feet in the cool stream on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to beduck the entire kitchen floor with water.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm beducked the picnic blanket, making everyone scramble for cover.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to beduck the burning house with water to put out the flames.

meanings.definition: To dip or immerse in water.
meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to beduck your phone in the pool.
meanings.sent2: The children love to beduck their toys in the bathtub during playtime.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally beducked his sandwich in the soup, creating a soggy mess.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to beduck the vegetables in boiling water before adding them to the stir-fry.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to beduck his feet in the icy river to continue his journey.

meanings.definition: To wet or drench with water.
meanings.sent1: The storm will beduck the streets, so it's best to stay indoors.
meanings.sent2: She likes to beduck her hair with a spray bottle to style it.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to beduck his friend with a water balloon from above.
meanings.sent4: The waterfall beducked the rocks below, creating a beautiful mist.
meanings.sent5: The car wash will beduck your vehicle, leaving it sparkling clean.
